name: Sukjunamul Muchim (Seasoned Mung Bean Sprouts)
ingredients: Sprouts & Cooking ● 1 lb mung bean sprouts, rinsed and drained ● Water, for blanching
Seasoning ● 2 cloves garlic, minced ● 2 teaspoons fish sauce ● 2 green onions, chopped ● 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil ● 1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add sprouts and blanch for 1 minute, stirring gently.
Drain and rinse under cold water. Shake off skins and let drain well.
In a bowl, combine garlic, green onions, fish sauce or salt, sesame oil, and sesame seeds.
Add sprouts and mix by hand until evenly coated.

name: Crispy Tofu with Broccoli
ingredients: Tofu ● 1 extra-firm tofu, pressed and cubed ● 1 tablespoon tamari ● 1 tablespoon cornstarch ● 3 tablespoons breadcrumbs
Broccoli ● 3 cups broccoli florets ● 1 tablespoon peanut oil

Sauce ● ⅓ cup tamari ● 2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil ● 1 tablespoon rice vinegar ● 1 tablespoons honey ● 5 cloves garlic, minced ● 1 tablespoon neutral oil ● 1 tablespoon cornstarch ● 4 tablespoons water, divided
Preheat oven to 400°F and line a sheet pan with parchment paper.
Toss tofu cubes with soy sauce. Coat evenly with cornstarch and breadcrumbs. Spread on one half of the sheet pan.
Spread broccoli florets on the other half of the pan. Drizzle with neutral oil.
Bake for 30–35 minutes, flipping tofu and stirring broccoli halfway through.

While baking, make the sauce: heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in soy sauce, sesame oil, vinegar, maple syrup, and 2 tablespoons water. In a separate bowl, whisk cornstarch with the remaining 2 tablespoons water, then add to the sauce. Cook until thickened, 2–3 minutes.
Transfer tofu and broccoli to a bowl. Pour sauce over and toss gently to coat.
Serve over rice or noodles. Garnish with sesame seeds or scallions if desired.

name: Sesame Bok Choy
ingredients: ● 1 ½ pounds bok choy, chopped into 2-inch pieces (separate stems and leaves)
Heat the oils in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. When shimmering, add garlic and ginger and stir for 30 seconds.
Add bok choy stems and red pepper flakes (if using). Cook, stirring frequently, for about 3–4 minutes until just starting to soften.
Add bok choy leaves and cook for another 2–3 minutes, until wilted.

name: Baby Bok Choy
ingredients: In a bowl, stir together water, ginger, garlic, oyster sauce, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes. Set aside.
Heat the oils in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. When oil is hot, add the bok choys
Stir fry for a few minutes, turning regularly, until the stems start to turn pale green, and the leaves are wilted. Transfer the bok choy to a serving dish.
Pour the sauce into the skillet, and cook until sauce has thickened slightly, about 3 minutes.

name: Creamy Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: sticks (1 cup) SOFTENED salted butter at RT (not melted)
Tbsp fresh parsley or chives, finely chopped for garnish

Peel potatoes and rinse in cold water (cut potatoes in half if very large). If you want the smoothest potatoes possible, remove the little knots from the potatoes with a small spoon or the tip of a potatoes peeler.
Place potatoes in a large pot (5 Qt+) and cover potatoes with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook partially covered until easily pierced with a fork (30’-1h) depending on the size of your potatoes).
Drain well and transfer to the bowl of your stand mixer.
Grab the whisk attachment and mash potatoes lightly by hand to break them up.
Fit mixer with whisk attachment and start on low speed 30 sec then increase to medium and slowly drizzle in 1 to 1 1/4 cups of the HOT  milk to reach your desired texture.
With mixer on, add softened butter 1 Tbsp at a time, waiting a few seconds between each addition. Potatoes will be whipped and fluffy.
Finally add 1 1/2 tsp salt, or add to taste.

Roast until golden and cooked through (about 45–60 mins for a whole chicken, 35–45 for pieces). Let rest before slicing.

name: Crispy Caesar Chicken with Roasted Carrots & Garlic Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim, peel, and cut carrots on a diagonal into ½-inch-thick pieces. Dice potatoes into ½-inch pieces. Peel garlic.

In a small bowl, combine cheese, half the panko (all for 4 servings), and a large drizzle of olive oil; season with salt and pepper. Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season all over with salt and pepper. Evenly spread tops of chicken with 1 tsp dressing each (save the rest for serving). Mound with panko mixture, pressing to adhere (no need to coat the undersides).

Toss carrots on one side of a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. (For 4 servings, spread carrots out across entire baking sheet.) Roast on top rack for 5 minutes, then remove from oven; carefully place chicken, crust sides up, on empty side. (For 4, leave carrots roasting; add chicken to a second sheet and roast on middle rack.) Roast until carrots are browned and tender and chicken is cooked through, 15-20 minutes more.

While carrots roast, place potatoes and garlic in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 10-12 minutes. Reserve 1 cup potato cooking liquid, then drain and return potatoes and garlic to pot. Keep covered off heat.
notes: Crispy Caesar Chicken with Roasted Carrots & Garlic Mashed Potatoes

name: Sourdough Bagels
ingredients: AT NIGHT: In the bowl of a stand mixer, stir together the starter, water, honey and salt. Add the bread flour and mix with a dough hook on the lowest speed for 6-7 minutes. The dough will be very stiff.
Cover the bowl and let rest at room temperature for 8-12 hours.

IN THE MORNING: Line a baking sheet. Turn the dough out onto a clean work surface and divide into 8 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a ball. Use your thumb to poke a hole straight down through the middle of the dough. Pick the bagel dough up, gently shape the ring and place on the lined baking sheet Repeat with remaining dough balls.
Cover the dough with a towel and let rise for 30-60 minutes or until puffy.
Preheat the oven to 425°F, with a rack in the center position.
Bring 6 cups water and 1 Tbsp sugar to a boil in a large stockpot.
Once the bagels have finished rising, boil them for 2 minutes on each side. (Only boil 3-4 at a time, making sure not to crowd the pot.)

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant but not browned.

Cook, uncovered, for about 45 minutes. Stir occasionally, adding salt if needed.
Discard the onion before tossing the sauce with pasta. This recipe makes enough sauce for a pound of pasta.

carrots, peeled and cut crosswise into 2-inch pieces
bottle (750 milliliters) fruity red wine, like Beaujolais (or fruity white if Nicole is there)

name: Pesto
ingredients: cups (try more) packed fresh basil leaves (1 TJ plant or a 4 oz box)
/3 cup (try 1/2 cup) grated or shredded Parmesan or Romano cheese (be careful with very fancy cheeses, like asiago)
/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, more to taste
Combine basil, garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, and nuts in the bowl of a food processor (a hand blender doesn’t work!).

name: Butter Paneer Masala
ingredients: (or more?) ounces canned diced tomatoes, pureed

name: Bacon & Roasted Tomato Linguine
ingredients: Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 400 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Halve tomatoes lengthwise; cut each half into three wedges. Peel garlic. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Zest and quarter lemon.

Toss tomatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, half the Italian Seasoning (you’ll use the rest later), salt, and pepper. Place garlic cloves in the center of a small piece of foil, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Cinch into a packet and place on same sheet. Roast on top rack until tomatoes are browned and tender and garlic is softened, 20-25 minutes.
Once water is boiling, add pasta to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 2 cups pasta cooking water, then drain.

name: Dijon Butter Steak
ingredients: Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place 3 TBSP butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; bring to room temperature.
Wash and dry produce. Dice potatoes into ½-inch pieces. Strip rosemary leaves from stems; finely chop leaves until you have 2 TBSP.
Halve, peel, and finely chop shallot until you have 1 TBSP.
Trim and discard woody bottom ends from asparagus.

Place potatoes in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Reserve ½ cup potato cooking liquid, then drain and return potatoes to pot. Meanwhile, if butter is not yet softened, microwave for 5-10 seconds. Add shallot, mustard, 2 tsp chopped rosemary (you'll use the rest later), and a pinch of salt and pepper to bowl with butter; stir to combine. Set aside.
Toss asparagus on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on middle rack until tender, 10-12 minutes.

name: Pepper Jack 'Shroom Quesadillas
ingredients: Wash and dry produce. Trim and thinly slice mushrooms (skip if your mushrooms are pre-sliced!). Zest and quarter lime. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion; finely chop a few slices until you have 2 TBSP (4 TBSP for 4 servings). Dice tomato. Finely chop jalapeño, removing ribs and seeds for less heat.

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until browned and tender, 5-7 minutes. (If mushrooms begin to brown too quickly, lower that heat!) Transfer to a plate and set aside. (Keep empty pan handy for Step 4.)

While mushrooms cook, in a small bowl, combine sour cream, lime zest, and a squeeze of lime juice to taste. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Season with salt and pepper.

Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for mushrooms over mediumhigh heat. Add sliced onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 8-10 minutes. Add ¼ cup water (⅓ cup for 4 servings) and 1 tsp sugar (2 tsp for 4). Cook, stirring, until onion is caramelized and jammy, 2-3 minutes more. Turn off heat; transfer to plate with mushrooms. Wash out pan.

name: Saucy Soy Mushroom & Pepper Bowls
ingredients: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Peel and finely chop garlic. Trim and quarter mushrooms (skip if your mushrooms are pre-sliced!). Core, deseed, and dice bell pepper into ½-inch pieces.

While rice cooks, toss mushrooms on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Toss bell pepper on another baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast until veggies are browned and tender, 15-20 minutes.

Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine 4 TBSP mayonnaise with as much Sriracha as you like. Taste and season with salt. When veggies have about 5 minutes left, remove sheet from oven; carefully toss mushrooms with half the sweet soy glaze (save the rest for serving). Return to oven until veggies are tender and glaze is tacky.

While veggies finish, heat a drizzle of oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Once hot, crack 4 eggs into pan and cover. (For 4, you may want to cook eggs in batches.) Fry eggs to preference. Season with salt and pepper.

Fluff rice with a fork and season with salt. Divide rice between bowls; top with roasted veggies and a fried egg. Drizzle with spicy mayo and sprinkle with remaining sesame seeds. Serve with remaining sweet soy glaze on the side (or drizzled over top for an extra-saucy finish!).

name: Coucous-stuffed Delicata Squash
ingredients: Adjust racks to top and middle positions and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Halve squash lengthwise; scoop out seeds with a spoon and discard. Place on a baking sheet; drizzle each half with olive oil and rub to evenly coat. Season generously with salt and pepper, then arrange cut sides down. Roast on top rack until tender and browned on bottom, 25-30 minutes.
Meanwhile, halve, peel, and dice onion. Trim and halve Brussels sprouts lengthwise; thinly slice crosswise into shreds.

Heat 1 TBSP butter (2 TBSP for 4 servings) and a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 3-4 minutes. Add couscous and half the Italian Seasoning (all for 4); stir until lightly toasted, 2-3 minutes.

While onion cooks, toss Brussels sprouts on a second baking sheet with a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on middle rack, tossing halfway through, until softened, browned, and slightly crispy, 9-12 minutes. (Check on these frequently—you want ’em deeply browned, not burned.)

name: Caramelized Onion Burgers
ingredients: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Cut potatoes into 1⁄2-inch-thick wedges. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Peel and finely chop garlic. Halve buns.

Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast until browned and crispy, 20-25 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Meanwhile, form beef into two 1⁄2-inch-thick patties (four patties for 4 servings), each slightly wider than a burger bun. Season all over with salt and pepper.

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, 8-10 minutes. Add 1 tsp sugar and 1⁄4 cup water (2 tsp sugar and 1⁄3 cup water for 4 servings). Cook, stirring, until caramelized and jammy, 2-3 minutes more.
Turn off heat; transfer to a small bowl. Wipe out pan.

While onion caramelizes, in a second small bowl, combine mustard, 2 TBSP mayonnaise (4 TBSP for 4 servings), and a pinch of garlic. Season with salt and pepper; stir until very smooth. (Use a whisk here if you’ve got one!)

name: Asparagus & Tomato Linguine
ingredients: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim and discard bottom 1 inch from asparagus; cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces. Peel and thinly slice garlic. Finely chop tomatoes. Zest and quarter lemon.
Once water is boiling, add pasta to pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, 9-11 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain.

Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add asparagus and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until browned and tender, 4-6 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Remove pan from heat and let cool slightly.

Once pan has cooled slightly, add 2 TBSP butter (4 TBSP for 4 servings) and garlic; return to medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, until butter has melted and garlic is fragrant, 30 seconds. Add tomatoes, half the Tuscan Heat Spice (all for 4), salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until slightly softened, 2-3 minutes.

name: Creamy Penne Primavera
ingredients: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. Trim and halve zucchini lengthwise; slice crosswise into ½-inch-thick half-moons. Trim and quarter mushrooms (skip if your mushrooms are pre-sliced!). Peel garlic; thinly slice one clove (two cloves for 4 servings) and keep remaining cloves whole. Zest and quarter lemon.

Toss zucchini and mushrooms on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of oil, half the Italian Seasoning (all for 4 servings), salt, and pepper. Place whole garlic cloves in the center of a small piece of foil and cinch into a packet; place on same sheet. Roast until veggies are browned and tender and garlic is softened, 14-16 minutes.

name: Sticky Umami Broccoli Bowls
ingredients: Wash and dry produce. Peel and finely chop or grate ginger. Cut broccoli into bite-size pieces. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Halve, core, and thinly slice bell pepper. Peel and finely chop garlic.

Meanwhile, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add broccoli, onion, and bell pepper; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until lightly browned and tender, 4-6 minutes. Add garlic and remaining ginger; cook, stirring, until fragrant, 30 seconds. Stir in soy glaze, soy sauce, and ¼ cup water (½ cup for 4 servings). Cook, stirring, until sauce has reduced and veggies are coated, 2-3 minutes. Stir in half the sesame seeds. Turn off heat; transfer veggies to a medium bowl. Wash out pan.

name: Beef Shepherd’s Pie
ingredients: Wash and dry produce. Dice potatoes into 1⁄2-inch pieces. Trim, peel, and finely dice carrot. Peel and finely chop garlic. Finely dice celery. Halve, peel, and finely dice half the onion (whole onion for 4 servings).

Place potatoes in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 10-12 minutes. Drain and return potatoes to pot. Keep covered off heat until ready to mash in Step 5.

name: Cheese-tastic Southwestern Hash
ingredients: Adjust rack to top and middle positions and preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Wash and dry produce. Dice potatoes and sweet potato into ½-inch pieces (peel sweet potato first for a smoother texture, if you like).
Core, deseed, and dice green pepper into ¾-inch pieces.

name: Cuban-Style Black Bean & Yellow Rice Bowls
notes: Cuban-Style Black Bean & Yellow Rice Bowls

name: Winter Vegetable & Orzo Casserole
ingredients: oz Parmesan or other flavorful cheese, like Gouda or Manchego

name: Sicilian Garlic Sauce
ingredients: /2 cup raw almonds or pine nuts
Finely  grind the nuts using a food processor.
Add garlic, basil, parsley, salt, pepper. Process until minced.
Add olive oil and tomatoes. Process until mixed and tomatoes in small pieces.

name: Pasta Primavera with Smoked Gouda
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
tablespoons chopped fresh or 1 tsp dried tarragon
Season steak with salt and pepper on both sides and let sit at RT for 30 minutes.

name: Broccoli Cheddar Bisque with Garlic Bread
ingredients: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. (If you have a toaster oven, feel free to skip preheating.) Wash and dry produce. Halve, peel, and dice onion. Peel and finely chop garlic. Cut broccoli into bite-size pieces.

Melt 2 TBSP butter (4 TBSP for 4 servings) in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and ¾ of the garlic; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 4-5 minutes.

Add 2 TBSP flour (4 TBSP for 4 servings) to pot; stir until lightly browned, 1-2 minutes. Gradually stir in 1 cup milk (2 cups for 4) until fully incorporated. Add stock concentrates and 1½ cups water (2½ cups for 4). Season generously with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, 6-10 minutes.

Meanwhile, place remaining garlic and 2 TBSP olive oil (4 TBSP for 4 servings) in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave until sizzling and fragrant, 30 seconds. Halve baguette lengthwise; brush cut sides with garlic oil and season with salt and pepper. Place, cut sides up, on a baking sheet. Toast in oven (or use your toaster oven) until golden brown, 3-5 minutes.
notes: Broccoli Cheddar Bisque with Garlic Bread

name: ROASTED GARLIC DIJON BUTTER STEAK	 with Broccoli & Mashed Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: Adjust rack to top position and preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut 2 TBSP butter (4 TBSP for 4 servings) into ½-inch cubes and place in a small microwave-safe bowl; bring to room temperature. Wash and dry produce. Peel and dice sweet potatoes into ½-inch pieces. Cut broccoli into bite-size pieces.
Place sweet potatoes in a medium pot with enough salted water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, 15-20 minutes. Drain and set aside. (Keep empty pot handy for step 5.)

Meanwhile, toss broccoli on a baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Peel garlic; place cloves in the center of a small piece of foil. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and cinch into a packet. Place on same sheet. Roast on top rack until broccoli is browned and tender, 12-15 minutes. Transfer broccoli to a plate. Return sheet to top rack until garlic is tender, 3-5 minutes more. Once garlic is done, carefully open packet and let cloves cool slightly.

While broccoli and garlic roast, finely chop chives. Pat steak dry with paper towels and season generously with salt and pepper. Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add steak and cook to desired doneness, 3-5 minutes per side. Turn off heat; transfer to a cutting board to rest. Tent with foil to keep warm.

Melt 2 TBSP butter (4 TBSP for 4 servings) in pot used for sweet potatoes over medium heat. Cook, stirring, until butter is foamy and flecked with amber brown bits, 1-2 minutes. (Take a whiff—it should smell deliciously nutty!) Return drained sweet potatoes to pot and mash with sour cream until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and peppe
notes: ROASTED GARLIC DIJON BUTTER STEAK	 with Broccoli & Mashed Sweet Potatoes

name: Sriracha Pork Stir-Fry
ingredients: While rice cooks, zest and quarter lime. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Peel and finely chop garlic. Roughly chop peanuts.
In a small bowl, combine soy glaze, chili sauce, half the Sriracha (save the rest for serving), and juice from half the lime.

name: Griddled Onion Burgers/Hamburgers
ingredients: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut potatoes into ½-inch thick wedges.
Toss potatoes on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast until golden brown and tender, 50’. Remove from sheet.

name: Instant Pot Thai Red Chicken Curry
ingredients: tablespoon Thai red curry paste preferably Maesri or Mae Ploy brand
oz. coconut milk (400 ml) full fat, preferably Aroy-D or Chaokoh brand
lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (½ kg) or breasts, sliced into thin bite-size pieces
¼ cup  low sodium chicken broth
Tbsp  fish sauce more to taste
tsp  brown sugar or palm sugar, to taste
cup bell peppers red and/or green, cubed
notes: Instant Pot Thai Red Chicken Curry

name: Irish Pancetta & Cabbage Soup
ingredients: (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
quart chicken stock, or as needed
Salt and black pepper to taste
cups Savoy cabbage or other cabbage, chopped bite sized
Cook Pancetta in a large, deep stockpot or saucepan over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain off any excess fat.
Stir in potatoes, diced tomatoes, and enough chicken stock to cover. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Stir in cabbage and allow the soup to simmer for a few minutes longer before serving.
Pressure cook everything but cabbage 5 minutes then slow release
Add cabbage and cook 1 minute then slow release

name: Butternut Squash with Spinach
ingredients: butternut squash, peeled, and cut in 1-inch cubes
ounces fresh baby spinach or kale
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
Toss squash and SP cubes, onion, salt, pepper, and olive oil together in a bowl until coated. Transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven until tender and starting to brown, ~45 minutes.
Add greens to a large bowl and add squash/SP piping hot

name: Quiches
ingredients: pie crusts, (note - store-bought crusts need ~1h to warm and are usually too sweet!)
onion (sub shallots if feeling fancy), chopped

name: Pie Crust
ingredients: teaspoon sugar (opt, don’t use if making a savory dish!)
Add butter chunks, pulsing until mixture resembles coarse meal, with a few pea-size pieces of butter remaining.
Add water, 1 Tbsp at a time, pulsing until dough is crumbly but so that a ball holds together when squeezed.

Cut the dough in half, and roll each into disk. The discs are just rough at this point; will roll and shape after chilling. Wrap each disk in plastic, and refrigerate at least 1 hour (or up to 2 days).
After the chilling: Let dough soften at RT slightly before rolling.
Roll out one dough disk to 13-inch round, on lightly floured surface.
Transfer disk to 9”-diameter glass pie dish. Trim, leaving 3/4” overhang.

name: Cholent
ingredients: lbs beef stew meat or brisket
cup dried beans - lima, pinto, chickpeas, red beans (not kidney)

name: Brazilian Recipes
ingredients: Heat the oven: Arrange 2 racks to divide the oven into thirds and heat to 450°F. Line 2  baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.

Boil the milk and oil: Place the milk, oil, and salt in a medium saucepan and bring to a gentle  boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat as soon as you see big  bubbles coming through the milk.

Add the tapioca flour: Add all of the tapioca flour and stir with a wooden spoon until you see  no more dry tapioca flour. The dough will be grainy and gelatinous at this point. 4. Cool the dough: Transfer the dough to the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with a paddle  attachment.

Beat the dough for a 3 minutes at medium speed until it smooths out and has cooled  enough that you can hold your finger against the dough for several seconds. There may be  an oily slick that is not fully incorporated.

name: pasta in the style of Naples 1842
notes: pasta in the style of Naples 1842

name: Sourdough No-Knead Bread
ingredients: Stir together flour, salt, and sugar in a 2.5 quart bowl.
Add hot water, and stir to combine. You want the mixture to just get to the point where there are no dry spots, and the dough is a little sticky. Cover bowl with a lid and let rise overnight.
In the morning, dough should be wet and bubbly. If not, dense bread can be good too!
Place dutch oven in the oven, on the highest rack on which it will comfortably fit. Prepare a loaf pan with cooking spray, or use an unsprayed silicone loaf pan. Prepare a floured surface.
Dump the dough onto the floured surface. Fold and turn dough and form into an ovoid chape.

Transfer dough to the loaf pan, dust with any leftover flour, and cover it with a cloth. Let rise until doubled, around 2 hours. Preheating will happen 1.5 hours into the rise as per the next direction.

name: Monkey Bread
ingredients: Generously butter a bundt pan. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Open the biscuit can, and cut each biscuit into bite-sized pieces with scissors
Combine white sugar and cinnamon in a gallon zip bag, and shake to mix evenly.
Drop biscuit bits into the cinnamon-sugar mix. Seal, and shake vigorously to coat each piece nicely with cinnamon-sugar.
Spread nuggets out evenly in bundt pan.
Melt butter with brown sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring just toaa  boil, then remove from heat. Stirring until a uniform color is reached.

name: 15-Bean, 15-Vegetable Soup
ingredients: /2 cup mushrooms (works well with wild mushrooms, like chanterelles)

name: Slow Cooker Gumbo
ingredients: /3 cup veggie oil or bacon drippings
cups sliced okra, fresh or frozen
/4 lb skinless, boneless chicken thighs, chopped (or shred at end?)

name: Mom's Noodle Casserole
ingredients: Cook the egg noodles as per package
Mix in the milk, cheddar, yogurt, and seasonings.
Pour the mixture into a wide, shallow casserole dish - more surface area for browning.

name: Passover Tabouleh
ingredients: ½ cup fresh or frozen pomegranate seeds
½ teaspoons smoked paprika or chipotle chile pepper
½ cup extra virgin olive oil
In a food processor, chop up the parsley. Add to a medium bowl.
By hand (or gently with the food processor) dice the unpeeled apple. Add to bowl.

name: Slow Cooker Pork Cacciatore
ingredients: thick, boneless pork chops (frozen work well)

name: Kale Citrus Salad Side
ingredients: Tbsp Sour Cream or Plain Greek Yogurt
bunch Kale, leaves torn off stems
Tangerines, peeled and cut into chunks

name: Zucchini and Mushroom Enchiladas
ingredients: /4 pound Cheddar or similar cheese, shredded
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini, mushrooms, onion, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Cook and stir until the vegetables are soft.
Warm the tortillas 2 to 3 minutes, until soft, in the preheated oven.

name: Tomato & Garlic Pasta
ingredients: /4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (or Asiago, Romano, or whatever)
Toss tomatoes with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper, then roast at 450º until soft & wrinkly.
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Drain pasta, but do not rinse, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.

name: Instant Pot Chili
ingredients: (15 oz) cans kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Brown sugar, kosher salt, black pepper to taste

name: Roasted Tomato Caprese Salad
ingredients: plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise, seeds (not cores) removed
/4 cup good olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F.
Arrange the tomatoes on a sheet pan, cut sides up, in a single layer.
Drizzle with 1/4 cup of olive oil and the balsamic vinegar.
Sprinkle with the garlic, sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.

name: Manicotti
ingredients: Cook manicotti in boiling water until done. Drain, and rinse with cold water.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine ricotta, mozzarella, and 1/2 cup Parmesan, eggs, parsley, and salt and pepper. Mix well.

name: Simple Fried Rice
ingredients: /2-1 lb tofu, cut into small squares

name: Zesty Slow Cooker Chicken BBQ
ingredients: Place chicken in a slow cooker. Pour over BBQ sauce.
Cover, and cook 3 to 4 hours on High or 6 to 8 hours on Low.
Combine 2 Tbsp flour with 1/4 cup water, and add to sauce to thicken.
Serve on buns or in tortillas.

name: Southern Fried Cabbage
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Drain the bacon slices on paper towels; crumble when cooled.
Drain all but 3 tablespoons of bacon drippings from skillet.
Cook and stir cabbage, onion, and mushrooms in the remaining bacon drippings until tender and lightly browned, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper.

name: Hummus
ingredients: can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained but not rinsed

name: Banana Bread _ Muffins
ingredients: very ripe bananas (around 2.5 cups), mashed well or very very ripe

name: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: pounds beef chuck roast, cut into 1/2-inch thick strips

name: Challah
ingredients: In the stand mixer bowl, dissolve yeast and 1 tablespoon sugar in 1 3/4 cups lukewarm water.
Whisk into yeast: oil, then 4 eggs - one at a time, 1/2 cup sugar, and salt.

name: Great Green Salad
ingredients: cups mixed salad greens (make sure to double dressing if using more greens)

name: Apricot Chickpea Salad Side
ingredients: oz canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed

name: Frosted Xmas Cookies
ingredients: cups all-purpose flour, more for rolling
cups butter (4 sticks), at room temperature

name: Beef with Snow Peas
ingredients: /2 lb Flank or Round Steak, trimmed & sliced very thin against the grain
Scallions, Cut Into 1/2” pieces on the diagonal

name: Latkes
ingredients: large Russet potatoes, peeled and grated
Lots of canola or peanut oil
Mix grated potatoes, grated onion, and salt.

name: Thanksgiving Posole
ingredients: dried posole pepper (~2 pasilla, 2 ancho, and 2 guajillo chile peppers) stems, seeds, and veins removed
~4 cups leftover turkey, diced or shredded
canned white hominy, rinsed and drained

name: Cavatelli Ragu
ingredients: lb chuck beef, cut into 4 large pieces

name: Spinach and Orzo Salad
ingredients: oz baby spinach leaves, finely chopped
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add orzo and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Meanwhile, combine spinach, scallions, pine nuts, and white pepper. Toss with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Mix in the orzo and the goat cheese.
Serve warm, or refrigerate and serve cold.

name: Creamy Baked Pears
ingredients: Bosc pears, halved and cored (make 1 pear per person)
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease a 9-inch baking dish with 1 tablespoon butter. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon sugar into buttered dish.
Arrange pears cut sides down in prepared baking dish, rub with remaining 1 Tbsp butter, and sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon sugar.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Flip pears, pour cream over pears, and continue baking until tender and cream is carmelizing, about 20 minutes more.

name: Slow Cooker Spanish Beef Stew
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
cups yellow potatoes, peeled and chopped
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown beef, about 5 minutes. Add salt & pepper while browning.
Transfer beef to a slow cooker, retaining some of the beef drippings in the skillet.
Saute onion and garlic in hot drippings until water evaporates, about 5 minutes; add to slow cooker.
Deglaze pan with 1 cup water and add the yummies to the cooker.
Add potatoes, diced tomatoes, and sofrito to the cooker.

name: Polka-Dot Blondies Dessert
ingredients: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.

name: Cashew Chicken
ingredients: (8 ounce) can sliced water chestnuts, drained
Dissolve the cornstarch in the chicken broth. Stir in the soy sauce, ginger, and hot sauce. Set aside.

name: Passover - Ashkenazi Charoset
ingredients: pound good apples (2-3 count), peeled, cored, coarsely chopped
/4 cup sweet Passover wine, such as Manischewitz
Let sit for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Taste and add more honey and cinnamon, if you’d like.

name: Pasta Primavera
ingredients: large leek, white and light green parts only, chopped

name: Crostini with Goat Cheese Side
ingredients: crusty baguette, cut into ¼ inch slightly diagonal slices
oz chanterelle or other fragrant mushrooms, cleaned and sliced

Preheat the oven to 400ºF. Lay the baguette slices on a baking sheet and drizzle lightly with olive oil. Bake for 13-20 minutes or until crispy and very lightly golden brown. Set aside until ready to use.

name: Isa Red Lentil Thai Chili
ingredients: red bell pepper, seeded and diced medium
sweet potato, cut into ¾- inch chunks
15-oz can kidney beans, drained and rinsed

name: Baked Sesame Tofu Side
ingredients: Place oven rack at 2nd tier. Preheat broiler on high.
Mix soy sauce and oil on a large plate.
Lay out slabs on baking sheet, and save soy sauce for serving.
At the table, supply reserved soy sauce with a transfer pipet.

name: Spicy Stewed Beef with Cheesy Grits
ingredients: oz chopped Chipotle Peppers In Adobo Sauce
notes: Spicy Stewed Beef with Cheesy Grits

name: Thanksgiving Candied Yams
ingredients: large yam, peeled and cut into 1/2” disks
Melt butter and brown sugar in a small pot. Remove from heat.
Add yam disks to brown sugar mixture, and stir to coat.
Lay disks out in a single layer on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or a baking mat.
Bake 45 minutes or until yams are very tender.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: cups cubed butternut squash, fresh or frozen
Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium heat.
Add onion. Cook until onion turns translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.

name: Broccoli Cheddar Bisque
ingredients: Preheat oven to 425 degrees (if you have a toaster oven, feel free to skip the preheating). Wash and dry produce.
Halve, peel, and dice onion. Peel and finely chop garlic.
Cut broccoli florets into a mix of ½-inch and ¼-inch pieces (this’ll add major texture variety, making this bisque a party in your mouth!).

name: Avgolemono Soup
ingredients: teaspoons salt, or more to taste

name: Tofu Broccoli Curry
ingredients: /4 pound Yukon Gold potatoes, cut into 3/4 inch pieces
large carrot, peeled and sliced on a bias, 1/4 inch thick

name: Spice-encrusted Salmon
ingredients: Combine spices (coriander, cumin, cayenne, sage, salt, and pepper). Press the spice mixture onto the top of each fillet.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat for 2 or 3 minutes. Add the butter and, when it shimmers, place the fillets, coated side down, in the pan. Cook about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the spice mixture forms a nicely browned crust.
Turn the fillets and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, or until the salmon is just barely opaque inside.

name: Classic Spaghetti Sauce
ingredients: oz ground beef or ground sausage

name: Slow-Cooker Thai Chicken
ingredients: /4 cup (+ extra for garnish)  cilantro, chopped
pounds skinless chicken thighs (frozen works great)
oz fresh baby spinach (can sub steamed baby broccoli or bok choy or something)

name: Shiitake Yakisoba
ingredients: /2 oz dried shiitake mushrooms (or 4 oz fresh)
oz dried fat udon noodles (or 12 oz precooked)

name: Hot Dish
ingredients: onion, garlic, and variety vegetables, chopped
cooked orzo, ditalini, or other small pasta shape
Stir in beans and pasta. Pour mixture into a casserole dish.
Bake 350º 20-30 minutes until hot and melty.

name: Fesenjan with Saffron Rice
ingredients: 1/2 pounds chicken thighs or breasts, cut into chunks

name: Tia Jessica's Yucatecan Guacamole
ingredients: a few drops of lemon juice

name: Firehouse Mac 'n' Cheese
ingredients: Scallions, sliced and separated into whites and greens
Microwave butter in a small microwave-safe bowl until melted, 30 seconds. Stir in panko and Frank’s Seasoning. Set aside.

name: Sesame Beef
ingredients: Mix soy sauce, sugar, 2 Tbsp oil, garlic, and scallions in a large bowl. Set aside.
Cut steak into strips and add to bowl. Cover and refrigerate overnight, or at least 30 minutes.
Saute onion and mushrooms in 2 Tbsp oil in wok or frying pan over med-high heat until softened.

name: Zucchini Bread
ingredients: Grease and flour an 8 x 4 inch pan. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

name: Avocado Bubble Tea
ingredients: First prepare the tapioca balls per the packaged instructions.
Bring ~5 cups water to a boil in a small pot.
Add 1 cup tapioca balls, and boil until they floated to the surface.
Lower heat to medium, let it boil for another 3 minutes, turn off the heat.
Leave tapioca balls in the pot for another 3 minutes.
Drain and rinse with cold water to cool them. Set aside.
Add avocado flesh, milk, and condensed milk into a blender, and blend it all up.
Place tapioca balls into a glass, top with the blended avocado mixture, stick a big straw in it, and enjoy!

name: Beany Chili
ingredients: jalapenos, thinly sliced (seeded, if you want it less spicy)
15 oz can fire-roasted salsa style tomatoes

name: Easy Garlic Shrimp
ingredients: pound large shrimp, shelled (except for tails) and deveined
In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, juice, garlic, cumin, red pepper flakes, salt and black pepper.
Add shrimp and toss to coat. Set aside and marinate for 20 minutes.*
Spread shrimp along with marinade in single layer in an oven-proof skillet or baking pan.

name: Ganache Drip
ingredients: Place chocolate into a microwave-safe bowl.
Pour heavy cream over the chocolate.

Place in the microwave for 1 minute. (Times may vary, see our note below). Remove and stir. Microwave for 30 seconds more. When the chocolate has melted almost completely, allow it to sit for 1 minute more before stirring.

Microwave times may vary. If you are making a smaller amount of ganache, you will reduce the microwave time. If your chocolate hasn't melted after the 1 1/2 minutes recommended in the instructions, simply microwave in small 10-15 second increments until it has nearly completely melted. Let sit one minute, then stir until smooth.
Stir until you've reached a silky smooth consistency.

The ganache will cool as it thickens. Cool for about 15-20 minutes or until you can pipe drips along the inside of your bowl and get the look that you are going for. (If the ganache is too warm, the drips will run all the way down. If they only drip part of the way down the bowl, it is ready. Some of this comes down to personal preference.)
I load my ganache into a disposable piping bag and snip the end away (start with a small hole, you can always make it larger).

name: Mama’s Strawberry Birthday Cake
ingredients: ounces fresh or frozen (but thawed ahead) strawberries, pureed
(18.25 ounce) package white or yellow cake mix (check for no artificial colors or flavors)

name: Egg Drop Soup
ingredients: Heat chicken broth, carrot, and green onions in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Mix sugar, soy sauce, cornstarch, and 2/3 cup cold water in a bowl until smooth.

name: Arugula Pesto
ingredients: teaspoon salt (tastes very salty at first but mellows dramatically as it sits and when added to pasta)
/3-1 cup freshly grated Parmesan or related
Turn on a food processor fitted with the steel blade, and drop in the garlic cloves. When they are chopped and adhering to the sides, stop the machine, and scrape down the sides of the bowl.
Add the walnuts. Turn on the machine, and process until they are finely ground. Scrape down the bowl again.
Add the arugula and the salt. Pulse until the arugula is finely chopped.
Turn on the machine and run while you slowly drizzle in the olive oil. When the mixture is smooth, stop the machine, scrape down the sides and process for another 30 seconds or so.
Work in the cheese and combine well.
Advance preparation: Cover the top with a film of olive oil, and this will keep in the refrigerator for a couple of days and taste even better.

ingredients: quarts chicken, turkey, or vegetable broth
cup shiitake and/or crimini mushrooms, sliced

ingredients: ounces mixed salad greens (a mix with arugula works well)
or more oranges or apples, chopped

Place bread crumbs and seasoning on a separate plate.
Dip chicken into mayo mixture then bread crumbs to coat. Arrange coated chicken on a baking sheet.

Add the spinach to the skillet and cover; allow to cook 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic salt and cover again for another 5 minutes; remove from heat.

(15 ounce) can black beans (bean types and ratios flexible)

name: Popcorn
ingredients: We’ll try 1 tsp salt for our 3/4 cup kernels

oz cooked, shredded chicken breast meat
can black beans, drained but not rinsed

Add chicken and sprinkle with poultry seasoning.

name: Chunky, Not-too-sweet Granola

ingredients: Melt butter with olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add asparagus spears, and cook, stirring occasionally for about 10 minutes, or to desired firmness.

Scoop the batter into the cupcake liners, filling them a little over half way full (a scant 1/4-cup. You should end up with exactly 14 cupcakes.

name: Berry Buttercream Frosting
ingredients: cup butter, softened to room temperature
Process the raspberries in a food processor or blender until a puree is formed.
In a small sized saucepan, gently boil the mixture while stirring occasionally.
Allow to boil for 10-20 minutes, or until it is about 1/4 to 1/3 of the original volume. It should be thick like jam.
Place in the fridge or freezer to chill fully.
In a large bowl, beat the butter until fluffy (a hand beater may work better than a stand mixer).
On low, beat in 2 cups of the powdered sugar.
Beat in 2-3 tablespoons of the chilled, thickened raspberry puree. (It must be cold when you add it).
Beat in the rest of the powdered sugar about 1/2 cup at a time until you get the desired sweetness level.
Beat the frosting on medium-high speed for an additional 30 seconds.

Return to freezer for at least hours.

Place bacon in a large, deep skillet or pot. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.

Cut the dough in half, and roll each into disk. The discs are just rough at this point; will roll and shape after chilling. Wrap each disk in plastic, and refrigerate at least 1 hour (or up to 2 days).
After the chilling: Let dough soften at RT slightly before rolling. Preheat oven to 425ºF.
Roll out one dough disk on lightly floured surface to 13-inch round.

name: Seared Salmon with Porcini Cream Sauce

Meanwhile, start olive oil, butter, & garlic in a large cold skillet and heat to medium to slowly toast garlic, ~10’. Reduce heat to medium-low when olive oil begins to bubble. Cook and stir until garlic is golden brown, about another 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Add red pepper flakes, pepper, salt, parsley.

name: Steamed Lemon Garlic Broccoli

Rub chops with 2 teaspoons seasoning salt and 1 teaspoon pepper, or to taste.
In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Brown pork chops on each side.
Add the onions and water to the pan. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Uncover the pan, turn chops over, and add remaining salt and pepper. Cook until water evaporates and onions turn light to medium brown.

fried eggs for grown-ups, one for kids

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add gnocchi, and cook until tender, 5 to 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, crumble the sausage into a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until evenly browned. Drain grease.

Zucchini - until is tender, about 2 minutes

name: Chilis Mas-o-Menos-Rellenos

Lay the peppers evenly in bottom of baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the Jack and Cheddar cheeses.

Bake in the preheated oven until just tender, 12 to 15 minutes depending on thickness. Sprinkle with lemon juice just before serving.

name: Pecan-Encrusted Salmon
ingredients: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a small bowl, stir together butter, mustard, and honey. Set aside.
In another bowl, mix together bread crumbs, pecans, and parsley.

name: Hungarian Goulash
ingredients: Place beef in slow cooker, and cover with onion.
In a medium bowl, stir together ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, salt, paprika, mustard, and 1 cup water. Pour mixture over beef and onions.

name: Easy Lemon Pepper Zucchini
ingredients: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place zucchini slices on a silicone baking mat on a baking sheet, and brush with melted butter. Season with lemon pepper.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until tender.

name: Gourmet Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: pound mushrooms (any kind; chanterelles were great), thinly sliced
/3 cup grated or shredded Parmesan cheese
freshly ground black pepper to taste
In a saucepan, warm the broth over low heat.

name: Creamy Chanterelle Soup
ingredients: In a saucepan over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil, then add the chanterelles, garlic and 1 Tbsp of the chives. Saute until mushrooms are done.
Stir in the white wine and chicken stock, and simmer for 30 minutes.

name: Quesadillas
ingredients: cups cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Mexican blend)
~2 cups combined chopped veggies. Options include:

name: Bacon-Spinach
ingredients: coarse salt and ground black pepper to taste
In a large pot over medium heat, fry the bacon until evenly brown and crisp. Drain and set aside.
In the same pan, cook and stir the onion for 2 minutes.
Add garlic, cook <1 minute, until fragrant.
Mix in the spinach until evenly coated. Cover skillet, reduce heat to low, and cook 5 minutes, stirring often, or until spinach is tender.

name: Tofu Cabbage Stir-Fry
ingredients: (6 ounce) package frozen pea pods, thawed

name: Salmon and Tomatoes in Foil
ingredients: For each of 4 packages, place one 12-inch-long sheet of aluminum foil on top of another.
Smear top sheet with 1/2 tablespoon olive oil
Layer a fillet of salmon, 6 tomato halves, salt and pepper, 4 basil leaves and another half tablespoon oil
Seal package by folding foil onto itself and crimping edges tightly. Repeat to make other packages, and refrigerate until ready to cook, no more than 24 hours later
When you are ready to cook, heat oven to 500 degrees.
Place packages on a cookie sheet and place in oven.

name: Tomato Zucchini Bake
ingredients: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly butter a 9x9-inch pan.

name: Mexican Chicken Bake
ingredients: Make rice. Spread in the bottom of a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Mix garlic, salt, pepper and cumin and spread them on a plate.
Heat olive oil in a skillet at medium heat.

name: Escarole and Beans
ingredients: head escarole (broccoli rabe worked well too), coarsely chopped
ounces cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
Place bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook until crisp, 7 to 8 minutes. Remove the bacon and reserve the drippings in the pan.
Add olive oil to the drippings and heat for 1 minute. Add the escarole; cook and stir for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the garlic, and continue cooking and stirring until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Pour in the chicken broth and beans, and season with red pepper flakes. Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes.

name: Berry Crisp
ingredients: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, gently toss together blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, and white sugar; set aside.
In a mixer bowl, combine flour, oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Cut in butter until crumbly.
Press half of mixture in the bottom of a 9x9 inch pan. Cover with berries. Sprinkle remaining crumble mixture over the berries.

name: Veracruz Fish
ingredients: fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped
(7 ounce) red snapper, tilapia, or cod fillets
teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

name: Tomato Tart
ingredients: /2 cup Grated Fontina Cheese (or Monterey Jack)
whole Basil Leaves, Chiffonade (more If Needed)

name: Awesome Grilled Cheese Sandwiches
ingredients: slices melty cheese (Cheddar, Monterey Jack, Mexican, Colby Jack, etc)
Preheat a pan for medium low heat.
Butter one side of each slice of bread.

Place a slice of bread in the pan. One by one, arrange cheese on each slice of bread, lay out thin layers of other toppings, top again with cheese, and then the other slice of buttered bread. Cover the pan and fry/steam for about 2 minutes per side. Repeat with remaining sandwiches.
Serve hot, and accompany with something green.

name: Potatoes and Peppers
ingredients: large onion (opt. sweet), peeled and chopped
Parboil potatoes for 5 minutes. Slice thinly when cool.
Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the potatoes for 5 minutes
Add the peppers and onions. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for at least 15 minutes, turning potatoes frequently, or until potatoes start to look mushy.

name: Roasted Vegetable and Kale Soup
ingredients: carrots, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
/2 small butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch pieces
salt and ground black pepper to taste
ounce sweet or hot (or both) Italian sausage links, casings removed
cups vegetable broth, or more if needed

name: Chili Verde Pork
ingredients: red chili peppers, stemmed and seeded
corn tortillas, shredded (I know, not really a liquid)
